She does this by taking orders from enough customers each week to later go out and deliver the orders and collect payment.  At home she also cuts hair, and paints finger-nails among other beauty services she provides.  For two years she has been doing this and things have gone well for her.

The loan will be used to buy household items such as irons, fans, mattresses and blenders, among others.

Her dream is to have her own house someday since she now lives with her father-in-law.

This member is shown in the photograph with her young son.

loans.use: To buy irons, fans, mattresses, blenders, etc.

loans.name: Lester Rolando

texts.es:
Lester de 30 años, es soltero,  vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con solo servicio de luz  en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertnece al departamento de Piura. La zona se caracteriza por ser de mucha actividad agricola, ganadera y artesana.

Lester se dedica  a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) desde hace varios años, su corral donde se encuentran sus ovejas son apropiados y espaciosos; se encuentran  en la parte posterior de su casa, los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño ideal las ofrece en el mercado de Tambogrande y Piura.  Con el dinero que va adquirir por sus ovejas podrá atender sus necesidades personales.  Su padre le a dado en herencia unas tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón, es otra forma como se ayuda económicamete.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados    asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorde de sus animales.  También lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y su producto.  Lester es una persona responsable y trabajadora con la única intensión de ayudar económica a sus padres en la casa como para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lester, 30, is single living in his parents’ house which only has electricity in Tambogrande District that belongs to Piura Department.  The area is known for having much farming, livestock raising and crafts making.

Lester has raised sheep for several years.  The corral holding his sheep is spacious and appropriate and located in his back yard.  He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed like natural grasses and once they reach ideal size he sells them in the Tambogrande and Piura markets.  Money he gets from the sale of his sheep is used to cover his personal expenses.  His father has passed on some farmland to him where he grows lemons which are an additional source of economic help.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed thus insuring good growth and development of his animals.  He will also use it to buy fertilizer to improve his farmland and thus his crop yields.  

Lester is a very responsible, hard working person whose only aim is helping his parents his parents economically at home to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Las Dedicadas Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "LAS DEDICADAS", PORQUE ES UN GRUPO DE MUJERESDEDICADAS EN CUERPO Y ALMA A SU TRABOJO Y FAMILIA PARA PROGRESAR. ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE MÉXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 7 INTEGRANTES. LA SEÑORA REBECA ES UNA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO LAS DEDICADAS, ELLA TIENE 56 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA LA SECUNDARIA, ES CASADA Y TIENE UN HIJO DE 16 AÑOS QUE ESTUDIA LA PREPARATORIA. LA SEÑORA REBECA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE PAN DE DULCE DESDE HACE 2 AÑOS. SOLICITA ESTE PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR HARINA, AZUCAR Y ALGUNOS UTENCILIOS QUE NECESITA. CON ESTA INVERCION QUE TENDRA SU NEGOCIO PIENSA AUMENTAR SIGNIFICATIVAMENTE SUS GANANCIAS, CON LAS CUALES ESPERA COMPRAR UN HORNO, ESTO LE PERMITIRA PRODUCIR PAN EN CANTIDADES MAYORES. CON LAS GANANCIAS OBTENIDAS PINSA PODER PAGAR LA UNIVERSIDAD PARA SU HIJO Y QUE ASI TENGA UN MEJOR FUTURO.
texts.en:
This group is called "LAS DEDICADAS", because it is a group of women totally dedicated in body and soul to their work and families in order to get ahead.  The group is located in the state of México and comprised of seven members. 

Mrs. Rebeca, 56, has a secondary education.  She is married and has a 16-year-old son in high school.  Rebeca has been in the pastry business for two years.  She is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar and needed utensils.  With this investment she hopes to increase her earnings significantly so she can buy an oven and produce a larger volume of pastry.  She also hopes to be able to pay for her son's university costs to give him a better future.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and utensils to make pastry.

loans.name: Las Hijas De Maria Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Las Hijas D. Maria” ya tiene 6 años D. funcionamiento y está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).   

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Lidia que vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y tiene tres hijos. DesD. joven se caracterizo por ser una persona responsable, amable y trabajadora y por tener estas cualidades sus amigas le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. Lidia se dedica a la venta D. bocaditos especiales llamados “Churros”, ella venD. D. forma ambulatoria sus productos en carretas acondicionadas para este negocio, ella trabaja con cinco empleados quienes atienden cada uno D. las cinco carretas. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como  por ejemplo azúcar, mermelada, majar, harina y otras cosas más. Ella tiene 51 años D. edad, es una persona con muchas ganas D. superarse y tener un negocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo D. brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS HIJAS D. MARIA" has been operating for six years and is comprised of hard-working entrepreneurs who are looking for opportunities to get ahead and proviD. a better future for their children.  The group meets every month in the city of Cusco.  Most of the members live in Cusco, Perú.

Here we meet Mrs. Lidia who lives in the beautiful city of Cusco with her three children.  From a very early age she stood out as a responsible, kind and hard-working person and, for these qualities, was invited by her friends to join the communal bank.  Lidia is a street vendor who sells a type of snack food called "Churros" out of specially prepared carts.  She works with five employees who attend to the five carts.  She is requesting a loan to buy more supplies such as sugar, marmalaD., flour and other things.  She is 51 years old and very intent on getting ahead and making her business successful so she can give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as sugar, marmalade, flour and other things.

loans.name: Guerreros De Cristo Group

texts.en: Juana Antonia, Santos Genaro, and Santos Bernabe, all residents of the San Lorenzo region in Honduras, collectively formed the “Guerreros de Cristo” solidarity group. All three applicants know each other well and will serve as guarantors of each other’s loans. Juana Antonia works out of her home, where she makes and sells bread as well as typical Honduran baked goods. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 8000 with which she will buy wood, corn, butter, cheese, and eggs—all ingredients used in the freshly baked goods she produces.  Santos Genaro is a father of two and has run a small convenience shop for several years. He is requesting a loan of Lps. 5000 to buy merchandise for his shop. Santos Bernabe is a furniture maker and is requesting a loan of Lps. 8000 to purchase supplies used in his business.

loans.use: To purchase corn, eggs, cheese, firewood, butter, beans, meats, cereal, milk, oil, salt, snacks, juices, sodas, personal hygiene products, light bulbs,candles, pinewood, laurel wood, mahogany, glue, nails, screws, varnish.

loans.name: Ytalo

texts.es:
Ytalo de 31 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertnece al departamento de Piura. La zona se caracteriza por ser de mucha actividad agricola, ganadera y artesana.

Ytalo se dedica  a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas ) y aves de corral desde hace 4 años, su corral donde se encuentran sus ovejas y aves son apropiados y espaciosos; se encuentran  en la parte posterior de su casa, los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos y granos naturales  y una vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño ideal las ofrece en el mercado de Tambogrande y Piura.  Con el dinero que va adquirir por sus ovejasy aves podrá atender sus necesidades de su hogar.  Su padre le a dado en herencia unas tierras de cultivo donde siembra mango en temporada de verano, es otra forma como se ayuda económicamete.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más ovejas y respectivo alimento asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorde de sus animales.  Ytalo es una persona responsable y trabajadora con la única intensión de ayudar económica a su familia para que sus hijos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Ytalo, 31, and his wife and children live in a house they own in the Peruvian "departamento" of Piura.  Local people earn their living from farming, raising livestock and selling traditional crafts.

Ytalo has operated a business raising and selling sheep and poultry for 4 years.  The yard behind his house, where he keeps the sheep and birds, is neat and spacious.  He raises the animals on a balanced diet of grass and natural grains.  When they reach the right size, he takes them to the markets at Tambogrande and Piura for sale.  The money that he gets for the animals is enough to pay the family's expenses.  He also operates a farming business on land left to him by his father.  The income from the mangoes that he grows there in the summer help too.

Ytalo is applying to Edpyme Alternative for a 1000 new soles loan that he will use to buy sheep and the supplies he needs to raise them.  He's a responsible and hard-working person and his only goal is to help his family and give his children the best possible start in life.

loans.use: to buy sheep and supplies for his livestock business.

loans.name: Rosa Amira

texts.es:
En la parroquia Rio Chico  del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como San Clemente, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal San Clemente De Rio Chico, este lugar es conocido por su vegetación y porque la mayoría de su gente se dedica al agro.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 61 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y quedo sola, pero de esa relación tuvo seis hijos ya todos mayores de edad e independientes, ahora ella vive sola ya que vivía con su mamá pero ella hace 4 meses también falleció.
 
Tiene un negocio de comidas rápidas en su casa en el cual también vende gaseosas y otras bebidas. Nos cuenta que además tiene en sociedad con uno de sus hijos una panadería la cual la administra su hijo y que la tienen en otra ciudad. Ella en su negocio trabaja todos los días desde las 14h00 hasta las 20h00, nos comenta que este negocio le sirvió de mucho una vez que falleció su esposo y que le sirve hasta la actualidad para sus gastos y  de distracción para olvidar tanta soledad.

Este crédito es para comprar harina, manteca, sal, huevos y otros ingredientes para elaborar el pan y carne, salchichas, papas, etc. para su negocio de comidas rápidas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos ciclos y le gusta todo del banco.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
In Rio Chico parish, in Portoviejo canton, we find a place called San Clemente.  Every two weeks, the members of the 'San Clemente de Rio Chico' community bank meet here.  This area is known for its vegetation and for the fact that most of the locals work in agriculture.

Here we meet 61 year-old Rosa.  Several years ago, Rosa's beloved husband passed away and she was left on her own.  She has six children from her marriage who are all grown up and live independently.  Now Rosa lives alone.  She used to live with her mom but, four months ago, her mom also passed away.

Rosa has a fast food business in her home where she also sells soda and other drinks.  She tells us that she also owns a bakery in partnership with one of her children.  Her son runs the bakery which is located in another city.  Rosa works in her business every day from 2.00pm to 8.00pm.  She tells us that the business has been a great help to her since her husband died.  It helps her to cover her expenses and also keeps her busy so that she is able to forget the great loneliness that she feels.

Rosa will use this loan to buy flour, butter, salt, eggs and other ingredients for making bread.  She will also buy meat, sausages, potatoes, etc. for her fast food business.  She has been a member of her community bank for two loan cycles and she likes everything about it.

Rosa's dream is to own a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, salt, eggs, meat, sausages, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 43 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Se desarrolla la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 3 años Rosa  se dedica  a la comercialización de leña para el uso diario de los diferentes pobladores de la zona, ya que no cuentan con cocina a gas, al ver que su negocio se ha incrementado, a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para adquirir más leña y poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes,con los ingresos que recaude podrá cubrir su crédito como seguir ayudando a solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Rosa es una mujer con muchas ganas de sacar a delante a su familia gracias a todo el esfuerzo y dedicación que tiene en su trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Rosa, 43, and her husband and children live in a house they own in the Peruvian "departamento" of Lambayeque.   The house only has one electrical outlet.  Most people in the area scrape by on the incomes from their farming and livestock businesses.

Rosa started a business 3 years ago selling firewood.  Cooking gas is not widely used in this part of Peru, so there's a lot of demand for firewood, a fact that's contribued to Rosa's success.  She's now applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new soles loan that she will use to buy firewood and meet the demand for it from her customers.  The income from the business will allow her to support her family.

Rosa is an ambitious woman and she's working hard to make sure her family gets ahead in the world.

loans.use: Compra de mayor cantidad de leña para la venta

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.en:
Juan Bautista, Maria Estela, and Raul from San Lorenzo, Honduras formed the Emanuel Solidarity Group. As part of this group they will collectively serve as guarantors for each other’s loans. 

Juan Bautista, who is 49 years old, married, and has two children, has operated a convenience store for the past 10 years, selling refreshments, basic foodstuff, and personal hygiene products. He has had three previous loans, all of which he used to invest in and grow his convenience store business. Juan Bautista is currently requesting a loan of HNL 8,000 which will be used to purchase merchandise for his store. He is very grateful for the previous financing he has received and aspires to continue expanding his business. 

Raul is 58 years old, married, and lives with his wife and granddaughter in a house he built himself 19 years ago. He operates a small convenience shop, selling basic foodstuff, refreshments, and household cleaning products. Raul is requesting a loan of HNL 5,000 with which he will buy additional merchandise to sell in his store. 

Maria Estela is 31 years old and married with five children. She has been selling tortillas from her home for the past two years, working seven days a week. Maria Estela gets up early every morning to grind the cornmeal that she uses to make fresh tortillas. This will be her first loan, and she is requesting HNL 5,000 to purchase corn, firewood, and lime—three essential inputs used to make fresh tortillas. Her dream is to eventually invest in a machine for making tortillas.

loans.use: To purchase snacks, sodas, juices, meats, cheeses, butter, salt, fruits, vegetables, cornmeal, light bulbs, candles, hygiene products, household cleaners, firewood and lime.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
Eufemia es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia que no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, la cual pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad principal a la agricultura, ganadería  y turismo (tiene festividades religiosas muy bonitas).

Eufemia desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado porcino (cerdos), caprino  (vaca) y aves de corral, su corrales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, loscuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada,  pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar animales, su alimento respectivo y mejorar sus corrales, con la finalidad que con los ingresos que obtenega pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Eufemia es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca cada vez más y que su familia se supere.
texts.en:
Eufemia, 45, and her husband and children live in a house they own in the Peruvian "departamento" of Lambayeque.   The house is basic, with no electricity.  Most people in the area scrape by on incomes from farming, raising livestock and tourist services.  (The area is known for its beautiful religious festivals.)

Eufemia has earned her living for many years raising and selling livestock: pigs, cattle and poultry.  The yard where she raises the animals is behind her house.  It's near and spacious.  She feeds the animals on a balanced diet of grass and natural grains.  When they're ready for market, she sells them at one of the local fairs.  The income from the sales contributes to supporting her family.  
 
Eufemia is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new soles loan that she will use to buy more animals and the other supplies she needs for her business.  The extra income that she will earn will go to repaying the loan and improving the lives of her family.  Eufemia is a hard-working and responsible woman and her only wish is that her business continue to grow so that she can go on helping her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy animals and supplies for her livestock business.

loans.name: Mercedes Lucely

texts.es:
En la parroquia Rio Chico  del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como San Clemente, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal San Clemente De Rio Chico, este lugar es conocido por su vegetación y porque la mayoría de su gente se dedica al agro.

La señora Mercedes es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos ya que no piden tantos requisitos comenta. Tiene  años de edad 44 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 21 y 10 años de edad, la mayor estudia en Cuba y este año se incorpora de médico y la menor aun esta en escuela. Su marido es chofer profesional.

Es una gran ama de casa que se dedica al comercio, vende  zapatos de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta o bajo pedido, trabaja tres días a la semana  por las mañanas que es más fresco y aprovecha que su hija pequeña esta en la escuela, nos cuenta que lleva cinco años en ese negocio y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos para damas, caballeros y niños.
 
Sus sueños  son seguir trabajando y crecer en su negocio día a día.
texts.en:
In Rio Chico parish, in Portoviejo canton, we come across a place called San Clemente.  Every two weeks, the members of the 'San Clemente de Rio Chico' community bank meet here.  The area is known for its vegetation and for the fact that most of the locals work in agriculture.

Mercedes is a founding member of her community bank and she tells us that she likes it because of the ease with which she can obtain loans (they do have so many requirements).  Mercedes is 44 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has two daughters aged 21 and 10.  Her eldest is studying in Cuba and this year she will become a doctor.  Her youngest is still in school.  Mercedes' husband is a professional driver.

Mercedes is a great housewife who is also a saleswoman.  She sells all kinds of shoes, making her sales door to door or to order.  She works three days a week in the mornings when it is cooler and she can take advantage of the fact that her youngest daughter is in school.  She tells us that she has been in this business for five years and it has done very well.

Mercedes will use this loan to buy ladies', men's and children's shoes.  Her dreams are to continue working and to grow in her business every day.

loans.use: to buy ladies', men's and children's shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy recharge cards and E-vouchers for mobile phones

loans.name: Killa Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Killa” tiene 3 años de funcionamiento y está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).   

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Lily que vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y tiene tres hijos. Es ama de casa y es una madre se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable, amable y trabajadora y por tener estas cualidades sus amigas le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. Lily nació en la ciudad de Langui de la provincia de Canas del departamento del Cusco. Lily es profesora pero en sus horas libres se dedica a la fabricación de chompas de lana de alpaca, ella tiene un pequeño taller implementado en su domicilio con las herramientas básicas. Ya son 20 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como  por ejemplo lana y hilos. Ella tiene 50 años de edad, es una persona con muchas ganas de superarse y tener un negocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo de brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Killa” community bank has been around for three years.  It is made up of hard-working and entrepreneurial people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead in life and, through their daily efforts, they work to provide their children with a better future.  The bank meets every month in the city of Cusco.  Most of the bank's members live in the city of Cusco (Peru).

During this meeting we meet Lily who lives in the beautiful city of Cusco and has three children.  She is a housewife and a mother who is noted as being a responsible, kind and hard-working person.  Because of these qualities, her friends invited her to become a member of their community bank.  Lily was born in the city of Langui, in Canas province, in Cusco department.  She is a teacher but, in her spare time, she makes sweaters from alpaca wool.  She has a small workshop in her home with the basic tools she needs.  She has been in this business for 20 years now and her business is doing very well.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy more materials such as yarn and thread.

Lily is 50 years old.  She is a person who has a great desire to improve herself and have a successful business as she would like to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as yarn and thread

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis es un padre de familia de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, la cual  cuenta con los servicio de agua y luz  en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a una hora de distancia del departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo (festividades religiosas que forma parte de las costumbres de los pobladores).

Jorge Luis  labora manejando su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 2 años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en su mismo distrito y a los diferentes caseíos de la zona, a pesar de la competencia que tiene, él trata en lo posible de movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos en todo el día, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades de su hogar.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 500 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi, al encontrarse su unidad móvil   en buen estado podrá seguir trabajando y brindando un mejor servicio para  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Jorge Luis es un hombre muy responsable, conocido en su distrito  por ser trabajador  y buen padre porque siempre trata que su familia se supere y que su hijo tengan otras oportunidades que él no pudo tener.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis, 26, and his wife and son live in a house they own just outside the Peruvian "departamento" of Lambayeque.   The house has water and electricity.  Most people in the area scrape by on incomes from farming, raising livestock and tourist services.  (The area is known for its beautiful religious festivals.)

Jorge Luis has a taxi business for about 2 years.  He owns a "mototaxi" (a vehicle designed for short trips and no more than 3 people at a time).  It's a local business that he operates in and around his neighborhood.  There are many competing businesses, so he tries to move as many passengers as he can, each and every day.  The income from the business goes to supporting his family.  
 
Jorge Luis is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new soles loan that he will use to service the mototaxi.  He has to maintain it so that he can continue working and providing for his family. Jorge Luis is a responsible man, known in the neighborhood for being a caring father.  He always puts his family first and is working to give his son the opportunities that he never had.

loans.use: to service vehicle for his taxi business.

loans.name: Orquideas Silvestre Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "ORQUIDEAS SILVESTRES", ESTA CONFORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES UNA DE ELLAS ES LA SEÑORA EDALI, ELLA TIENE 38 AÑOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN MORELOS, MÉXICO. LA SEÑORA EDALI VIVE EN UNION LIBRE SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA ALBAÑILERIA ACTUALMENTE, TIENEN TRES HIJOS 2 HOMBRES Y UNA MUJER, LA SEÑORA EDALI LLEVA DIEZ AÑOS DEDICANDOSE AL COMERCIO. LA SEÑORA EDALI COMENTA QUE ELLA COMENZO VENDIENDO ALGUNOS PRODUCTOS POR CATALOGO SOLO EN SU COLONIA Y POSTERIORMENTE EMPEZO A VENDER MAS VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS Y EN OTROS LUGARES A SUS ALREDEDORES DE SU COLONIA, COMENTA QUE CON SUS VENTAS PUEDE APOYAR A SU ESPOSO EN LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA Y EN LOS ESTUDIO DE SUS HIJOS, ELLA A FUTURO QUIERE PONER UN LOCAL PARA TENER UN  POCO MAS DE INGRESOS. CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE COMPRAR MÁS MERCANCIA COMO ZAPATOS Y COSMETICOS PARA TENER MÁS VARIEDAD EN SU NEGOCIO Y ASÍ PODER OFRECER TODO LO QUE NECESITAN SUS CLIENTES. CON LAS GANANCIAS QUE OBTENGA QUIERE SEGUIR INVIRTIENDO Y AHORRAR PARA OFRECERLES UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA A SUS HIJOS. OBSERVACIONES LA SEÑORA QUE NO SE VE BIEN EN LA FOTO SE LLAMA MARIA.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Orquídeas Silvestres' (Wild Orchids) and it has nine members.  One of the group's members is 38 year-old Edali who lives in Morelos, Mexico.

Edali lives with her common-law husband who is a construction worker.  They have three children: two sons and one daughter.  Edali has been in the sales business for ten years.  She tells us that she started out selling some products through a catalog, just in her district.  She then started selling a wider variety of products in neighboring districts as well.  She tells us that, through her sales, she is able to support her husband with their household expenses and is able to help pay for her children's education.

In the future, Edali would like to set up business premises so that she can make a little more income.  She would like to use her loan to buy more merchandise such as shoes and cosmetics, so that she can offer a wider variety of products in her business and thereby be able to offer her customers everything they need.  With the profits that she makes, she would like to continue investing and also saving so that she can offer her children a better quality of life.

(Note: the lady who can't be seen very well in the photo is called Maria).

loans.use: to buy footwear and cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia es una mujer soltera de 28 años de edad, tiene casa propia, contando con los servicios de agua y luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de San José, que se encuentra a unos minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la pesca, agricultura y comercio al por menor y mayor de pescados y mariscos.

La actividad que desarrolla Cecilia es a la venta de productos de todo tipo (arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, pañales, útiles de escritorio, etc), en su propio domicilio a colocado su negocio desde hace 3 años, al tener su tienda en su casa puede atender a cualquier hora, lo que le permite diferenciarse de otras y así pueda obtener más ingresos para su uso personal.

El crédito solicitado por a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos, una vez que sus ventas aumenten cubrirá su crédito y mejorará su nivel de vida.  El sueño de Cecilia es tener más adelante una tienda que se dedique a la venta de productos al por mayor para que le genere mayores ingresos y pueda invertirlo colocando otro tipo de negocio.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 28, lives in a house that she owns in the Peruvian "departamento" of Lambayeque.   The house has water and electric service, but nothing more.  Most people in the area scrape by on incomes from fishing, farming and retail businesses.  

Cecilia started a corner shop 3 years ago.  She sells all kinds of everyday products (rice, milk, cooking oil, sugar, diapers, pens and paper, etc.).  She operates the business at home so she can open it at any hour, an advantage that distinguishes her business from others and helps to increase her income.  

Cecilia is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new soles loan that she will use to buy larger quantities of goods so that she can expand the range of products she sells.  She extra revenue will allow her to repay the loan and improve her standard of living.  Cecilia's dream is to one day have a wholesale business, something that would generate much more income and possibly allow her to set up another kind of business, as well.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Aracely Moncerrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia Rio Chico  del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como San Clemente, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal San Clemente De Rio Chico, este lugar es conocido por su vegetación y porque la mayoría de su gente se dedica al agro.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Aracely, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 24 y 18 años, ambos estudian en universidad y en la actualidad los dos viven en su casa. El marido es taxista. 

Ella tiene una panadería en su casa en la cual dia a día durante más de 15 años ha trabajado, le ayudan su hermano y su cuñado a quienes les paga un sueldo semanal, con ellos desde la tarde del dia a anterior dejan la masa preparada para el dia siguiente hornear el delicioso pan. Además de esto ella también en las tardes y noches vende comidas rápidas, gaseosas,  jugos y batidos de frutas, esto lo hace desde las 14h00 hasta las 19h00v ya que después tiene que dedicarse a preparar el pan para el dia siguiente.

Este crédito es para comprar harina, manteca, sal, huevos, etc. para elabora el pan y carne, salchichas, papas, etc. para su negocio de comidas rápidas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos se ha ayudado mucho para comprar lo necesario para mejorar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es modernizar el negocio con nuevas maquinarias que le faciliten el trabajo.
texts.en:
In Rio Chico parish, in Portoviejo canton, we come across a place called San Clemente.  Every two weeks, the members of the 'San Clemente de Rio Chico' community bank meet here.  The area is known for its vegetation and for the fact that most of the locals work in agriculture.

Here we meet Aracely who is 42 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  They have two children aged 24 and 18 who are both studying at university.  Their children both currently live at home.  Aracely's husband is a taxi driver.

Aracely has a bakery in her home where she has worked every day for the past 15 years.  Her brother and brother-in-law help her and she pays them a weekly wage.  They leave the previous evening's prepared dough so that, the next day, they can bake their delicious bread.  In addition, Aracely also sells fast food, soda, juice and fruit smoothies in the afternoons and evenings.  She does this from 2.00pm to 7.00pm since at that time she needs to prepare her bread for the following day.

Aracely will use this loan to buy flour, butter, salt, eggs, etc. for making her bread.  She will also buy meat, sausages, potatoes, etc. for her fast food business.  She has been a member of her community bank since it was established three loan cycles ago and she enjoys being a member because the loans have helped her a lot in buying what she needs to improve her business.

Aracely's dream is to modernize her business with new machines that will make her work easier.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, salt, eggs, meat, sausages, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena  es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con  servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el departamento de Lambayeque.  Los habitantes de ésta zona se dedican a la actividad agrícola, ganadería y turismo.

Lorena se dedica desde hace unos años al servicio de preparación y venta de comida en los diferentes molinos que existen en la carretera a Lambayeque ofreciendo menú para los obreros que laboran ahí, también vende ropa de trabajo y sandalias a los mismos trabajadores.  Al ver que su negocio va creciendo a solicitado un préstamoa Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar de insumos para seguir preparando la comida y mayor cantidad de ropa para los trabajadores que es lo que más demanda tiene, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.

Lorena con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza y el respeto de sus vecinos, demostrando que cuando uno quiere puede lograr su objetivo, como que sus hijos tengan mejores estudios en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Lorena, 30, is a mother living with her husband and children in her own house which has water and electricity and is located in Lambayeque Department.  Residents of this area are farmers, raise livestock and work in tourism.

For some years now Lorena has been making and selling food at the various mills that exist along the highway to Lambayeque.  She offers daily menus to the workers who work there.  She also sells work clothes and sandals to those same workers.

Seeing that her business is gradually growing she asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles to buy ingredients to continue preparing the food and to buy a larger amount of clothes for the workers since this is what’s in greatest demand.  Income she earns will be used to repay the loan and to have a better quality of life for her family.

With her work and determination to get ahead, Lorena has won over the trust and respect of her neighbors proving that when one wants to one can reach one’s goals like her children having a better education in the near future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare the meals and to acquire more clothes for the mill workers.

loans.name: Emma Araceli

texts.en: Emma Araceli lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras with her three children. For the past 15 years, Emma Araceli has made a living by selling freshly prepared food out of her home.  Her three children help her with this job. She is a new client and is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 with which she will buy necessary ingredients for her food preparation business.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, rice, oil, butter, cheese, salt, tortillas, eggs, plantains, and beans.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca De Cusco Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Señor D. H. D. Cusco” tiene 3 años D. funcionamiento y está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Margarita que vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y tiene cinco hijos. Es ama D. casa y es una madre se caracteriza por ser responsable, amable y trabajadora y por tener estas cualidades sus amigas le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. Margarita nació en la ciudad D. Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Margarita nos cuenta desD. muy joven trabajo como lavandera D. ropa y lo hacía a mano pero ella lavaba la ropa D. los jugadores D. futbol del equipo representativo D. la ciudad del Cusco “Cienciano”. Pero Margarita supo ahorrar y con el pequeño capital que tenia abrió un restaurante que lo bautizo con el nombre D. “El Burrito Amigable”. Ya son 12 años que tiene el pequeño restaurante y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como  por ejemplo arroz, fideos  y azúcar. Ella tiene 67 años D. edad, es una persona con muchas ganas D. superarse y tener un negocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo D. brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Señor D. H. D. Cusco” community bank has been around for three years.  It is maD. up of hard-working and entrepreneurial people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and, through their daily efforts, they work to proviD. a better future for their children.  The bank meets every month in the city of Cucso (Peru).

During this meeting, we meet Margarita who lives in the beautiful city of Cusco and has five children.  She is a housewife and a mother who is noted for being responsible, kind and hard working.  Because of these qualities, her friends invited her to become a member of their community bank.

Margarita was born in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department.  She tells us that, since she was young, she worked washing clothes.  She did this work by hand and she washed the kits of the players from Cusco's soccer team "Cienciano".  However, Margarita know how to save and, with the little capital that she had, she opened a restaurant which she called 'El Burrito Amigable' (The Friendly Donkey).  She has owned her small restaurant for 12 years now and it is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business.

On this occasion, Margarita needs a loan to buy more supplies such as rice, noodles and sugar.  She is 67 years old and a person who has a great desire to improve herself and have a successful business so that she can proviD. her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy more supplies such as rice, noodles and sugar

loans.name: Rayen Mapu Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Rayen Mapu” y está conformado por 18 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. Todos ellos se dedican a diferentes rubros, pero principalmente venta de ropa usada y nueva, además de artesanía. 
María quien en la foto aparece en el centro del grupo, vistiendo un chaleco color verde y su cabello tomado. Se dedica a la venta de bebidas, cervezas, cigarrillos, confites y alimentos, todos estos productos los vende puerta a puerta en un sector rural de la ciudad de Temuco, puesto que en el campo no hay negocios, para esto María traslada su mercadería en una camioneta.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas cada 15 días. María se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 2 años. 
Con el préstamo comprará bebidas, cervezas y fardos de ropa usada, ya que también aprovecha de vender ropa en el campo. 
Sus metas en su negocio son seguir invirtiendo en mercadería para abastecer a éstos sectores rurales de productos, ya que sus clientes no cuentan con un local establecido para comprar. 
María vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 15, 10 y 2 años de edad.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además disfruta de las reuniones a las que asiste, ya que ha aprendido a organizar sus gastos e ingresos de su negocio y la grata compañía de las demás socias del banco comunal. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “Rayen Mapu” and it has 18 members who live in the city of Temuco.  They all work in different businesses but they mainly sell used and new clothes and make handicrafts.

María appears in the center of the group wearing a green cardigan with her hair tied back.  Her business is selling drinks, beer, cigarettes, chocolates and food.  She sells all these products door to door in a rural sector of the city of Temuco since there aren't any businesses in the countryside.  María transports her merchandise in a truck.

María buys her merchandise in wholesale supermarkets every two weeks.  She has been in this business for two years.  She will use her loan to buy drinks and beer, and bundles of used clothes since she also sells clothes in the countryside.  Her goals for her business are to continue investing in merchandise so that she can supply these rural sectors with products since her customers don't have an established store where they can buy goods.

María lives with her husband and her three children aged 15, 10 and 2.

María is very happy and grateful for the support that Fondo Esperanza have offered her since her loans have allowed her to invest in her business.  She also likes the meetings that she attends since she has learned how to organize her business incomings and outgoings and she enjoys the pleasant company of the other members of her bank.

Temuco is the capital of Araurcanía region.  The city is located 670km south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  In the surrounding areas there are a series of lakeside spas (Pucón, Villarica) and very striking native flora and fauna in nearby nature reserves.  50% of the country's population of mapuches (indigenous people) live in this region.

loans.use: to buy drinks, beer and bundles of used clothes

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana tiene 65 años D. edad, es casada, no presenta carga familiar directa. Ella cuenta con casa propia,  la cual  está ubicada en  el distrito D. José Leonardo Ortiz a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo la cual cuenta  con todos los servicios básicos.

Juana, cuenta con un  negocio D. venta D. comida y ceviche al paso en el parque LaTina,  es un puesto ambulante, en el que ella ofrece diariamente comida la cual es preseparada por ella misma ,  Juana cuenta con  experiencia en el rubro y es  bastante conocido en el sector,.

Juana está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda realizar mejoras en su negocio, Juana desea comprar una congeladora, para que pueda guardar sus insumos necesarios para la preparación D. sus comidas  

Juana cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales, las que demuestran D. su responsabilidad y empeño, Juana desea poder salir adelante y obtener una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Juana, 65, is married and has no direct family dependents.  She has her own house located in José Leonardo Ortiz District which is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo; it has all basic utilities.

Juana has a business selling food and ceviche (marinated seafood cocktails) outsiD. at the La Tina Park. It is a vending stand where she sells food that she herself prepares daily.  Juana has experience in this line of work and is quite well known in the sector.

Juana is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to make some improvements in her business.  Juana wants to buy a freezer so that she can store the ingredients required for her meal preparation.

Juana has good personal and work related references demonstrating her responsibility and dedication.  Juana wants to be able to get ahead and obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for her business.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio de 57 años de edad,vive con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona desarrolla la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla Herminio es a la venta de embutidos y anticuchos en las afueras del mercado de Cayaltí, por ser un lugar muy transitado y vender productos de calidad sus ventas aumentarán, al igual que su clientela, para poder ampliar su negocio a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la comprá de más embutidos para su venta.  Con las ganancias que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y solventar sus gastos de su casa.

Herminio es una persona empeñosa y responsable que desea que su negocio crezca para brindarle un nivel de vida mejor a su esposa.
texts.en:
Herminio, 57, lives with his wife in his own house that only has water and electricity located in Cayaltí District which belongs to Chiclayo Province.  This zone is a farming and livestock raising area.

Herminio sells cured meats and anticuchos (skewered grilled meat) outside the Cayaltí market.  Because of its high level of foot traffic and because he sells quality items his sales will increase as well as his customer base.  To expand the business, he’s thought it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more cured meats to sell.  Profits he gets will be used to repay the loan and cover his household expenses.

Herminio is a very dedicated, responsible person who wants his business to grow to provide his wife with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more cured meats.

loans.name: Edwin Darvin

texts.es:
Edwin padre de familia de 37 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Olmos que pertence al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona desarrolla la actividad agrícola, ganadería y turismo (lugares turísticos y festividades bonitas).

Desde hace 6 años labora en el fundo FRUTOS OLMOS SAC como trabajador de la planta, por lo que realiza en el fundo se le brinda un pago mensual para que pueda cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su familia.  Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para realizar algunos arreglos en su casa y para cubrir algunos gastos personales, lo que le permitirá tener a su familia un poco más de comodidades.

Edwin es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades académicas en un futuro.
texts.en:
Edwin, 37, is a father living with his wife and children in his own house that has water and electricity and is located in Olmos District belonging to Lambayeque Department.  This is a zone of farming, livestock raising and tourism (tourist attractions and pretty festivities).

He has been employed for the last six years as a laborer at the FRUTOS OLMOS SAC large agricultural firm.  For his work there he’s paid a monthly salary in order to be able to cover daily family needs.  He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to do some home improvements and to cover some personal expenses which will allow his family a bit more comfort.

Edwin is a very hard working, responsible person.  All he wants is that his children have better academic opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to do some home improvements and cover some personal expenses.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 21 años de edad, ella es soltera vive en casa de padres, vive en una comunidad grande en vías de crecimiento llamada San Lorenzo ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, a unos 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Su vivienda cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz eléctrica.

Maribel se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado mochoqueque ubicado en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz , está actividad la realiza la viene ejerciendo en forma ambulatoria, cuenta con una experiencia de 3 años en forma continua, su madre también cuenta con un puesto de venta de verduras.

Maribel está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000  nuevos soles , este  dinero lo utilizará para comprar más mercadería aduciendo una oferta en precios, con el cual piensa incrementar sus ventas y por consiguiente mejorar su calidad de vida. Maribel tiene como visión comprarse una posesión de puesto fijo y así aumentar su capital de trabajo.

Maribel es una joven entusiasta, responsable, las personas que la conocen la describen con una buena persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus madre.
texts.en:
Maribel, 21, is single living in her parents’ house located in a large, developing community called San Lorenzo in José Leonardo Ortiz District, about 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  Her house has electricity and water.

Maribel sells vegetables in the Mochoqueque Market located in José Leonardo Ortiz District.  She’s been a vendor for three years; her mother also has a vegetable stand.

Maribel is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy merchandise citing a price offer that she’ll use to increase sales and thus improve her quality of life.  Maribel’s future goal is to buy the rights to a fixed sales stand to increase her working capital.

Maribel is a young, enthusiastic person.  People who know her describe her as quite dedicated and hard working.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman to improve her and her mother’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Tommy

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Tommy.  He is married and has 2 children, ages 11 and 2 years old. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because he is his nephew. 

In 2000, Tommy established his drinks business. He began his business because he wanted to have more income to provide livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Tommy requires a loan in order to buy additional drinks for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. 

In the future, Tommy plans to get a house, educate his children and extend his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more beverages for his business

loans.name: Lubinda

texts.es:
Lubinda es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene  02 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, dicha casa está ubicada en el caserío Chica Alto en el distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de  Piura. Lubinda  vive en la parte rural de este distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

Lubinda cuenta con negocio de bodega-bazar, el cual está ubicado en su domicilio, su negocio lo atiende personal y permanentemente, ella cuenta con un buen nivel de inventarios y la bodega es una de las más concurridas en el sector.

Lubinda está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles, para que con este dinero pueda comprar mercadería para su negocio, de esta manera pueda contar con distintos productos en calidad, diseño y precio para que sus clientes puedan escoger. 

Lubinda es una clienta conocida por Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado su puntualidad y responsabilidad, ella cuenta con buenas referencias, por parte de las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona ,tranquila y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Lubinda is a 41 year old mother.  She is married and has two children under her care.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her children.  The house is in the Chica Alto village, in the Tambogrande district, Piura department.  Lubinda lives in the rural part of this district, but she does have electricity.

Lubinda has a general store-bazaar business, which is in her home.  She personally and continuously takes care of the business.  She has a good level of inventory in the store, and it is one of the most popular in the sector.

Lubinda is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to be able to buy merchandise for her business.  This way she will be able to have products that differ in quality, design and price.  This is so that her customers can choose.

Lubinda is a known client of Edpyme Alternativa.  She has demonstrated her punctuality and her responsibility.  She has good references from the people who know her.  They describe her as a calm and hard-working person.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, los cuales son independientes. Ignacio vive en una comunidad rural, pequeña llamada Pueblo Seman en el distrito de Guadalupe en el departamento de La Libertad, en el norte del Perú.

Ignacio se dedica ala elaboración de ladrillos, los cuales están hechos en base de arcilla trabajada con pajilla en forma de bloques, los mismos que posteriormente son puestos en horno. Cuando se tiene el producto terminado Ignacio los vende por millares o cientos, Ignacio se dedica a esta actividad  desde hace más de 6 años en los que a obtenido experiencia en el rubro y en los que ha conseguido clientela fija para su negocio.

 Ignacio está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar gran cantidad de pajilla, y de esta manera pueda realizar una mayor cantidad de ladrillos, que le han solicitado.

Ignacio es un padre entregado a su trabajo muy responsable, y honesto, su más grande anhelo es poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ignacio, 40, has four adult children who are independent.  Ignacio lives in a small rural community called Pueblo Seman in Guadalupe District in La Libertad Department in northern Peru.

Ignacio manufactures bricks out of a base made from clay and straw shaped into blocks that are then baked in an oven.  When the product is finished, Ignacio sells it by the thousands or the hundreds.  Ignacio has been in this business for over 6 years and has acquired both experience in this line of work and a fixed base of regular customers.

Ignacio is requesting a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a large amount of straw to use in making a larger number of bricks he has on order.

Ignacio is a father who is dedicated to his work; he’s very responsible and honest.  His greatest wish is to provide his family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy straw.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 55 años de edad, ella es viuda, no cuenta con carga familiar,  sus hijos son mayores de edad.  Vive en casa propia propia, la cual está ubicada en el caserío llamado  La Cría en el distrito de Patapo a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  

Yolanda  se desempeña como trabajadora en una empresa agropecuaria prestando servicios auxiliares, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace 30 años  aproximadamente, posee ingresos mensuales por esta actividad y adicionalmente se dedica a la cría animales menores ubicados en la parte posterior de su casa.

Yolanda  está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles  para que con este dinero ella pueda cubrir gastos personales y arreglos a su vivienda, esto con la finalidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.

Yolanda es una clienta conocida por Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado su puntualidad y responsabilidad, ella cuenta con buenas referencias, por parte de las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona, tranquila y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 55 years old.  She is a widow and doesn't have any dependents as her children are already grown up.  Yolanda lives in her own home which is in a small village called La Cría, in Patapo district, one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Yolanda works for an agricultural company, providing auxiliary services.  She has been in this line of work for approximately 30 years.  She receives a monthly wage for her work.  In addition, she raises animals in an area behind her home.

Yolanda is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to cover some personal expenses.

Yolanda is an existing client of Edpyme Alternativa and she has shown herself to be both punctual and responsible.  She has good references and the people who know her describe her as a calm and hard-working person.

loans.use: to cover personal expenses

loans.name: Ana Maritza

texts.es:
Ana tiene 27 años D. edad, elL. es casada, tiene 02 hijos menores D. edad.  Cuenta con casa propia L. cual está ubicada en el Fundo Los AyaL. del Caserío en el departamento Lambayeque a 20 minutos D. L. ciudad.

Ana se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. animales en especial D. aves como pollos, patos y pavos. Ana se dedica a esta actividad desD. hace 05 años en su domicilio. Ana cría sus animales en corrales ubicados en L. parte posterior D. su domicilio y quincenalmente los venD. en los mercados D. Lambayeque o Chiclayo. Adicionalmente Ana se dedica a L. elaboración y venta D. chicha (bebida oriunda del Perú) L. cual prepara  en su propio domicilio.

Ana está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles para que pueda adquirir alimento balanceado para sus animales y también para comprar insumos para preparar chicha.

Ana es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad D. vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en: Ana is 27 years old, married, and has two dependent children. She owns her own home in Fundo Los Alaya, one of the annexes that forms the small village of Punto Nueve, in Lambayeque department, 20 minutes from the city. Ana raises and sells animals, especially birds such as chickens, ducks and turkeys. She has been running this business from her home for five years. Ana raises her animals in pens which are located behind her home and she sells them every two weeks in the markets of Lambayeque or Chiclayo. She also makes and sells chicha (a traditional Peruvian drink) which she prepares in her own home. Ana is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can acquire balanced feed for her animals. She will also buy supplies for making chicha. Ana is a hard-working woman who strives to get ahead and enjoy a better quality of life. The people who know her consider her to be a kind woman who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals and supplies for making chicha

loans.name: Jorge Francisco

texts.es: Jorge Francisco es un hombre muy responsable que desea ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida es por ello que el mismo construyo su propio patrimonio al cual desea ampliar para tener mayor espacio. Desde hace 10 años el se dedica a la construcción de casas tipo americano y ampliación de vivienda, de esta manera es como el percibe ingresos para sostener los gastos del hogar. Jorge esta construyendo un recamara en su casa pero por falta de capital para comprar el material no la ha terminado por tal motivo solicita el apoyo para que pueda realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Jorge Francisco is a very responsible man who would like to offer his family a better quality of life.  For this reason, he built his own home which he would like to extend in order to have more space.  For 10 years, Jorge has been building American-style houses and extensions.  This is how he makes income with which to cover his household expenses.

Jorge is building a bedroom in his home but, owing to a lack of capital, he has not been able to buy the materials he needs and has not finished the job.  For this reason, he is requesting support so that he can carry out his project.

loans.use: to build a bedroom

loans.name: Dos De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Dos de Mayo” tiene 4 años de funcionamiento y está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones D. banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad D. Cusco. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad D. Cusco (Perú).  

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Eusebia que vive en la hermosa ciudad D. Cusco y tiene tres hijos. Es ama de casa y en particular es padre y madre para hijos y sus amigas la consideran una persona responsable, amable y trabajadora y por tener estas cualidades le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. Eusebia nació en la ciudad de Quiquijana de la provincia de Quispicanchis D. departamento D. Cusco. Antes Eusebia trabajaba en la municipalidad de la ciudad de Anta, ella era obrera de construcción civil pero ahora se dedica a la venta de leña. Eusebia se dedica a la venta de leña y tiene un pequeño espacio donde guarda su mercadería y de donde también vende sus productos. Ya son 4 meses que empezó con el negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más leña. Ella tiene 37 años de edad, es una persona con muchas ganas de superarse y tener un negocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo de brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Dos de Mayo” [May Second] community bank has been going for 4 years. It is made up of hardworking and enterprising people who are always looking for chances to get ahead and every day strive for a better future for their children. The community bank's meetings are held every month in the city of Cuzco. Most of the members live in the city of Cuzco (Perú).  

At this meeting we meet Eusebia. She lives in the beautiful city of Cuzco and has three children. She is a housewife and is both mother and father to her children. Her friends consider her to be a responsible person who is kind and hardworking. Because of these qualities, they invited her to join the community bank. Eusebia was born in the city of Quiquijana in the province of Quispicanchis of the departament of Cuzco. Before, Eusebia worked for the city hall of the city of Anta. She was a construction worker, but now she sells firewood. She has her own space where she keeps her merchandise and sells the product as well. It has been 4 months since she began her business and it is going very well for her thanks to the dedication she brings to her work. At this time, she needs the loan to buy more firewood. She is 37 years old and a person who really wants to get ahead and have a succesful business day to day, always wanting to offer the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lay a concrete floor

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora María Guadalupe es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora que desea ofrecer a sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida. En este momento desea colocar una losa en su casa ya que tiene la construcción detenida por falta de capital; por tal motivo solicita el apoyo en la institución para comprar el material de construcción. Aunque María comenta que actualmente vive en la casa de su marido y es donde viven sus hijos, esto no la detiene a terminar de construir su propio hogar por que este será el  fututo y patrimonio que les ofrecerá a sus tres pequeños cuando crezcan.
texts.en: María Guadalupe is a very responsible and hard-working person who would like to offer her three children a better quality of life.  Right now, she would like to lay a concrete floor in her home since building work has been paused owing to a lack of capital.  She is requesting support from our institution so that she can buy building supplies.  Although María tells us that she currently lives in her husband's home together with her children, this doesn't stop her from wanting to finish building her own home which will be the future property that she will offer her three young children when they grow up.

loans.use: to lay a concrete floor

loans.name: Llancasun De Arin Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Llancasun D. Arin” tiene 7 años D. funcionamiento y está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad D. Huaran D. provincia D. Calca del departamento del Cusco. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la comunidad D. Huaran que está ubicado a una hora D. la ciudad del Cusco. (Perú).  

En esta reunión conocimos al señor Juan Ariel que vive en la hermosa comunidad D. Huaran. Es el jubilado D. la policía y su esposa es jubilada D. educación por el Arte. Ellos con sus ahorros abrieron un pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta D. comestibles en su domicilio en la misma comunidad donD. viven. Juan Ariel y su esposa son responsables, amables y trabajadores y por tener estas cualidades sus vecinos les invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. Ya son varios años que empezaron con el negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, tarros D. leche y otras cosas más. Él es una persona con muchas ganas D. superarse y tener un negocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo D. brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Llancasun D. Arin" communal bank has been operating for 7 years. Its members are workers and entrepreneurs who seek every opportunity to get ahead and give their children a better future thanks to their work. The communal bank meetings are once a month in the village of Huaran, province of Calca, department of Cusco. Most members live in the village of Huaran, located one hour away from the city of Cusco (Peru). 

At one of the meetings we meet Juan Ariel, who lives in the beautiful village of Huaran. He is a retired policeman and his wife, a former art teacher, is retired as well. With their savings they opened a small food catering business which they run from home, in the same village where they live. Juan Ariel and his wife are responsible, pleasant and hard working and because of these qualities their neighbours invited them to join the communal bank. They started the business several years ago and it's going well thanks to their hard work. In this occasion, he needs the loan to buy more merchandise, such as rice, sugar, milk and other things. He is a very eager person and wants to run a successful business, always wanting to proviD. the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as rice, sugar, milk and other things

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Sarah has a food shop that sells a variety of snacks like rice & cheese cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like flour, eggs & food seasonings. Sarah is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sarah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like flour, eggs & food seasonings

loans.name: Agustin Bisman

texts.es: El señor Agustin Bisman y la señora Maria Luisa, son casado desde hace cinco años tienen un hijo de 8 años Agustin, ellos viven en la zona del Plan 3000 en el departamento de Santa Cruz, en una casa en alquiler ya que no tienen casa propia, el señor se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano como taxista y la esposa trabaja como empleada doméstica; ambos trabajan puesto que lo que  ganan solo alcanza para subsistir y  su única herramienta de ingreso es su taxi, los riesgos de esta actividad son los accidentes y su vehículo acaba de sufrir un accidente y como es su herramienta principal de trabajo y de ingresos por tal motivo  necesitan el crédito para poder arreglar su herramienta de trabajo y así poder seguir llevando el pan del día para su familia. Agustin y su familia han logrado mantener a su hijo bajo las condiciones muy aceptables, y nunca le han hecho faltar nada, desean que en el futuro tenga una mejor condición de vida por ello dia a dia luchan para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Agustin Bisman and María Luisa have been married for five years.  They have an 8 year-old son called Agustin and live in Plan 3000 district, in Santa Cruz department.  They do not own their own home and so they live in a rental house.

Agustin provides an urban transport service as a taxi driver and his wife works as a house cleaner.  They both work since the money they earn is just enough to survive on.  Agustin's only tool for earning money is his taxi.  The risks he faces in his business are accidents.  His vehicle has just suffered an accident and, as it is his main work tool with which he makes money, he needs a loan so that he can repair it and thereby continue providing for his family.

Agustin and his wife have managed to support their son in very acceptable conditions and they have never let him want for anything.  They hope that, in the future, he will have better life and for this reason they struggle every day to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with two children. Leonila has a food shop that sells frozen foods like hotdogs & ham. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional frozen foods like hotdogs & bacon. Leonila  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Leonila  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods like hotdogs & bacon

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with four children. Meriam has a food shop that sells rice by the kilogram & roasted pig by the kilogram. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional sacks of rice & pigs to be roasted. Meriam is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Meriam hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additonal sacks of rice & pigs to be roasted

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. Elsa has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts & blouses from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell. Elsa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additIonal stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Melanie has a piggery and sells the grown pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy feed for the pigs. Melanie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Melanie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon and her husband have made a living as rice cultivators in Siem Reap province since 1990. They grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. They generate an income of around US $5 per day. This humble couple has five children; three are single and two are married. One of their children works as a domestic construction worker. The family recently encountered an issue with their living conditions as their old house was damaged during rain storms. Mrs. Phon is requesting a loan since the family doesn’t have the immediate cash to repair their house.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Nelson is working in an eatery as a service crew member and will use the loan to provide for his daily needs. He had been working for two years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy food & clothing for his personal needs. Nelson is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nelson hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy food & clothing for his personal needs

loans.name: Gantugs

texts.en:
Mr. Gantugs is a 33-year-old stone worker. He lives with his wife, Ariunzaya, and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His eldest two children attend a local secondary school. His wife works at a rehabilitation center as a nurse. Gantugs is member of the Mongolian stone workers association. The association helps him to find job orders from clients. 

Last year, Gantugs took a loan from us and started his restoration project of his family house. The loan was repaid on time, but the project wasn’t finished yet. He is asking for an another loan to complete the restoration project. He is planning to buy necessary building materials such as cement, sand, insulation materials for the walls, roof, central heating system to make his house warm to withstand the Mongolian harsh winters. When the project is finished, the house will be much warmer and more efficient in use of coal for heating and emitting a much lesser amount of smoke to the air.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials to make his house warm to withstand the Mongolian harsh winters

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 48 years old and married with 7 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Sharon is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Sharon has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from knitting.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, pictured here, and her husband, Seun, have been married since 1990. They have one son and three daughters. One of their children is married and living outside the family home, one is studying music, and the other two are in school. The family lives along National Road Two, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophal sells fish and vegetables and her husband works as a motor remoque taxi driver. (A motor remoque is a motorcycle with an attached rear trailer.) She is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a musical instrument for her son who is learning music.

loans.use: to purchase a musical instrument for her son

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 59 years old and is married with four adult children. She runs a restaurant where she sells prepared food such as meatballs, soup, and other dishes to the community. Myrna has been in this business for 20 years.

Myrna is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to buy meat and vegetables to prepare dishes to sell in her restaurant. In the future, she hopes that her business will expand and continue to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat and vegetables to prepare food

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 48 years old and married. For the past 10 years, she has operated a retail shop where she sells a variety of products such as toothpaste, soap, and condiments. Visitacion earns about 3,000 PHP monthly.

Visitacion is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan to purchase additional products to offer the community in her store. In the future, she hopes that her general store will someday become a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Aun and his wife, pictured here, are vegetable farmers. The couple lives approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh and has four sons and five daughters. Two of their children are married and live away from the family, three are garment factory workers, and the others are in school.

Aun is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to continue his farming business. He will buy seed, seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Hamat

texts.en:
Hamat, who is pictured here, is a fisherman. His wife sells the fish that her husband catches in the local market. In addition, the couple supplements their income with a business selling recycling materials.

Hamat is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase additional fishing nets for his business. In the future, he hopes to continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng, 43, is married to 49-year-old Mr. Chhoun, who supports their family by fishing along the Tunle Sap River. The couple wakes up at dawn every day to gather the fish from the nets which they put in the water the night before. They then reset the nets in the water to harvest fish again in the late afternoon. After gathering the fish from the river, Mrs. Leng hurries to the market so that she can sell it at a suitable price. If she has some fish left over, she will turn it into dried fish or fish paste. This family has recently been unable to catch as many fish as before because their boat is often broken. Hence, Mrs. Leng is applying for a loan to purchase a new boat to replace the broken one.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Rom produces rice wine and raises pigs. Her husband sells grocery items at home.
