Elle s'active dans la vente de pétrole, de l'huile de palme et du savon. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de mieux développer ses activités qui marche très bien, car la demande et supérieur à l'offre.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de renforcer ses épargnes et de participer à l'achat de nourriture et d'habillement pour sa famille.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 28, 2002. The 10 women who make up this group all live in the same neighborhood and their business is selling various small items.

Madame Awa, who is on the right in the photo, raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 69, married, and the mother of six children. She is also raising one child who was confided to her by a neighbor.  

She works selling kerosene, palm oil, and soap. She has a lot of experience in this field which she has been in for several years. This loan will allow her to expand her business which is going well, since the demand is greater than she can keep up with. 

The profit will allow her to put aside more in savings and help buy food and clothing for her family.

loans.use: to buy kerosene, palm oil, and soap.

loans.name: Soforal Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 octobre 2001. les femmes qui forment le groupe habitent toutes dans le même quartier. Elles mènent comme activité la vente de crevette, des produits de cueillette, d'arachide et de balai.

madame félicité qui est à droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 60 ans. Elle est veuve et a en charge six enfants. 

Elle s'active dans la vente de crevettes, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années. Secteur d 'activité qu'elle maitrise parfaitement.

Le prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité.

les profits lui permettront de prendre en charge les frais de nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on October 19, 2001. The women who make up the group all live in the same neighborhood. Their business is selling shrimp, edibles gathered from the fields and forests, peanuts and brooms. 

Madame Félicité, who is on the right in the photo raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 60 years old, a widow, and raising six children. 

She has a small business selling shrimp, which she has been doing for several years. This is a field she is quite knowledgeable in. The loan will allow her to bolster her business. 

The profit will allow her to pay the expenditures for food for the family.

loans.use: to buy shrimp.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy entrants, seed, and small tools and equipment.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur is married and the father of five children. He is running their agricultural business. He cultivates potatoes, wheat, corn and walnuts. Also he feeds the cattle and he spends all his time working at his business. 

Bahodur has good experience in this business and he has been in this business for 10 years. His wife and his children help him in everything that they can do. Bahodur would like to get a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy seeds, fertilizers, fuel, fodder and two head of livestock.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, fuel, fodder and two head of livestock.

loans.name: Kiilu

texts.en:
Kiilu is a married man who has five children in school.  To earn a living for his family, he runs a barber shop (kinyozi).   He has five years of experience in the business and has employed five people.  He was able to grow his business with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya.  

Kiilu also does farming to generate additional income.  He hopes to open another barber shop so that he can generate more income for his family.   Kiilu has requested 34,980 Kenyan shillings so that he can install electricity in his rural home.

His dream is to see his children excelling in their education.

loans.use: To install electricity in his rural home.

loans.name: Byambatogtokh

texts.en:
Mr. Byambatogtokh is 55 years old and a blacksmith. He lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They have three children who are grown up and live separately with their families. Byambatogtokh’s wife is a pensioner and she looks after the household.

Until 2008 Byambatogtokh worked for a metal construction company. He is an experienced blacksmith who makes different household metal items such as metal stoves, piping, farming tools and so on by customers' orders. Currently he rents a small workshop near his home. He is planning to expand his business by buying some necessary instruments like a welding machine, a metal cutter, a metal bender and so on. The loan he is taking will be used to buy necessary instruments essential to his blacksmith business and to buy more metal sheets.

loans.use: To buy necessary instruments for his blacksmith business and more metal sheets as raw material.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and small equipment.

loans.name: Isererero Farmers Group

texts.en: 35-year-old January has been operating a butcher shop for the last decade in Kihihi. Before he embarked on this business, he was mostly preoccupying himself with a timber sales business. January is happily married with four kids and he says he began this butchery business with savings from his timber sales business. Weekly he says his sales revenue totals shillings 150,000 and he says with this loan, he is going to purchase more goats for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to sell their meat.

loans.name: Mahabadhan's Group

texts.en:
Mahabadhan is the leader of this group. She is 59 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons; the first son works as a cook in Osh and the second works in a brick factory. Mahabadhan and her husband are engaged in farming. Twenty-two years ago they sold part of their harvest and purchased cattle. Since that moment they have been breeding cattle. 

Mahabadhan applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase more cattle. She believes that the loan will help her to realize the plan and she will repay the loan successfully. In the future she wishes to build a new house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 40 years old and married.  He does tailoring to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years and has employed two people to assist him in his tasks.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in financial management. He used his previous loan to boost his business.  In five years, he hopes to expand his business and employ more people. He has requested 40 000 KES to buy fabric to make clothes and a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela, a 38-year-old, is married and has a 19-year-old child in college.  She has been operating a charcoal selling business.  Previously, she was operating a green grocery. Besides selling charcoal, she owns rental houses that generate additional income.  Angela testifies that since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business. Angela needs 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy charcoal. She hopes that someday she will expand her business into wholesale.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Ayubjon

texts.en:
Ayubjon is married and has three children. He makes a living selling foodstuffs in his grocery store. His location is very attractive and he serves many customers because he is willing to work late. Ayubjon has been in this business for 15 years and knows a good deal about it. Ayubjon is also a very punctual and detail-oriented person, character traits that help him in his business. Ayubjon can always figure out how many supplies he needs so there is enough on hand to meet customer needs and it is always fresh. Ayubjon has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items to sell. He will spend the additional income made possible by this loan to improve his living conditions. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a new assortment of food to sell

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
Zafar is married and has three lovely children. His family lives in Isfara, where he also operates his business producing lime. He has been working at his workshop day and night for the many years. Zafar is a hardworking businessman. He is also a skilled professional and his expertise allows him to run his business successfully. Zafar offers only high quality products and cheerful and customer-friendly service. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Somoni to purchase raw materials and increase his income as a result.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to produce lime

loans.name: C1914 Shirubute Group

texts.en:
Francine, 30 years old and the married mother of a four-year-old, also takes care of one relative. Francine is the leader of the group called "SHIRUBUTE," which in English means " DON'T BE LAZY," a phrase that is well-known in her well-organized tailoring business, which has been in operation for two years. Working from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. everyday, she currently employs one person to help her. In the photo, Francine is the second person from the right in the second row, wearing a white T-shirt and glasses.

Francine and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their tailoring businesses by purchasing new materials. They will reinvest additional profits into their enterprises and save money to pay their children`s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase new materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is 30 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. He has a small retail shop, which he has run for five years.
To help expand his business, Haruna has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Haruna hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale.

loans.name: Zugu

texts.en:
Zugu is 26 years old, single and has no children. He has a small retail shop, which he has run for less than one year.
To help expand his business, Zugu has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as maize flour, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Zugu hopes to generate greater profits and take care of himself. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as maize flour, for resale.

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.en:
Nasimjon lives in Khujand, Tajikistan. He is married and has a daughter. From the region of Spitamen, he transports fine and coarse gravel 1-2 times a day. After being in this business for four years, he has gained experience.  Before, he rented a truck but now he bought his own truck. The business is stable and generates considerable income for Nasimjon’s family, allowing improved living conditions. Currently Nasimjon wants to expand business. That’s why he needs a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase another truck. Nasimjon thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: To buy a truck

loans.name: Nematullo

texts.en:
Nematullo has been dedicated to the business of purchasing and selling horses for the last 10 years. This business requires a lot of dedication because it  takes a lot of effort to carry out the breeding.  Dedication is necessary because the work requires strict control of every animal and at the same time feeding and caring for those that are older.

Through this business, Nematullo is able to support his spouse and his 5 children.   He is soliciting a loan through IMON International to buy more animals, which he will raise and sell in the market. Nematullo has gained a reputation for being responsible with his financial obligations and for keeping his word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business.

loans.use: purchase more horses

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 29 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Daniel has a small retail shop, which he has run for one year.
To help expand his business, Daniel has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Daniel hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. In the future, he hopes to expand his business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Khodour

texts.en:
Khodour is a 38-year-old married man who is father to two children.  He has been the owner of a chicken shop since 2003. Khodour sells both live and  butchered chicken, depending on his clients' requests. His shop is clean compared to others in similar business.  He specializes in good quality products and affordable prices.

Khodour also makes special chicken dressings and prepared plates such as crispy escalope, in addition to selling eggs.  He needs a refrigerator to keep these products fresh.  For that reason, Khodour has requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner to buy a refrigerator. This is Khodour's fifth loan cycle with Al Majmoua.  His previous loans have reflected positively on his expanding business and increasing operations.  

Khodour works hard to improve his business in order to satisfy his family's needs and to expand his region of work.  He hopes to expand his business more and more in the future through selling cooked chicken plates and sandwiches.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator for his business

loans.name: Ramathan

texts.en:
Ramathan is 30 years old, married and has two children, neither of whom is currently in school. Ramathan has a small retail shop, which he has run for two years.
To help expand his business, Ramathan has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Ramathan hopes to generate greater profits and buy food and basic necessities for his family. In the future, Ramathan hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en:
Ravshan is a married father of three children. His family lives in Kanibadan where he runs a small grocery store selling food products in the downtown area of his hometown. Ravshan's store is well-known in this neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours.  The late hours are very convenient for many customers who work late and go shopping after they are done with their work. Ravshan has been in this business for 7 years. 

Ravshan is seeking a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase foodstuff to increase the variety of his selling products. He has had some struggles as his business was growing and becoming self-sustainable. However, he handled all these challenges well and is looking toward the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.

loans.use: purchase foodstuff for his grocery store

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 32-year-old married man who has a 2-year-old child.  For four years, he has been working as an insurance agent.  Being a businessman, he decided to join a group in Faulu Kenya so that he can get easy access to business loans.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on financial management and he is currently saving his money on a weekly basis with his group members.  

Peter needs 30,000 Kes to buy a computer for his office.

loans.use: buy a computer for his office

loans.name: Davron

texts.en:
Davron is dedicated to the rearing of cattle. He carries out this work every day for the purpose of improving the living conditions for his family, bringing the daily bread to his table, and saving for the improvement of his dwelling, which needs a lot of help because it is in a bad state. His family admires him for the fact that his multiple efforts have permitted him to feed them and provided them with good living conditions.  

Davron wants to develop and invest in his business through the purchase of more cows.   He hopes that IMON International, with the help of Kiva, will offer him the loan needed to expand his business.

loans.use: purchase more young cattle

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is 25 years old, married and has one child, who is not currently in school. He has a stationery business, which he has run for three years.
To help expand his business, Isaiah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stationery materials, such as books, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Isaiah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food and basic necessities for his family. In the future, Isaiah hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase more stationery materials, such as books, for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and four young children who are still attending school. He has been involved in the construction field for the past 11 years. He works on a freelance basis using his own winch and sticking with multiple construction projects. He has one part-time employee helping him achieve the work tasks. He is the only income source of the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his winch and replace his old tools with new ones. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by opening a construction office and working with some construction entrepreneurs. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his winch

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock his store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with one parent and one sibling. She has owned a shoes and bags shop in her town since 2004. She only sells women's shoes and bags. She always tries to offer the new trends and collections to her customers. She is well known in her town and neighboring villages and she is thankful for her business income, which allows her to satisfy her family needs. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products to sell. In the future, she is planning to open a new branch.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married man living with his wife and three young children who are still attending school. He is from Lebanon. He is the main income provider of his family. He has owned his land since 2007 and has been involved in the agriculture field for the past 15 years. He only cultivates oranges and lemons.  In parallel, he used to work in the Lebanese army but now he has retired. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fertilizers and perform the needed maintenance on the water canal. He is sure that the loan will help him improve his work. In the future, he is planning to cultivate all types of vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and perform maintenance on the water canal

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and seven children, six of whom are still attending school. He has owned a flower shop since 2002, and has 20 years of experience working in this business. He sells both real and artificial roses. He works hard to earn a good income in order to be able to meet the family expenses, especially his children's schooling. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional products needed. He intends to increase his business sales in order to earn a higher income and be able to better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products needed.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one child. Since 2003 he has owned a medical clinic where he works as physiotherapy specialist. He is known as a very good physiotherapist and has a wide range of clients visiting his clinic in order to obtain the required treatment. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., to purchase an advanced physiotherapy machine. In this way, he will be able to provide his customers with more helpful services. In the future, he is planning to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase an advanced physiotherapy machine.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and five school-aged children. She has owned a lingerie shop since 2009. She is considered a new business owner, but she already has more than 15 years of experience in the same occupation. She has been able to hire a full-time employee since her business was established. She works hard in cooperation with her husband, who works in the construction field, to be able to pay their heavy life expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to increase her shop’s inventory. In the future, she is planning to open a clothes store.

loans.use: to increase her shop’s inventory.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 34 years old.  He is married and has three children aged 5, 7 and 10.  He operates a van transport business to earn a living.  He has employed two people to assist him in the business.  In addition, he also runs a green grocery store for extra income.  He says that through Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable because he has grown his business.  Samuel has requested a loan for 20,000 Kes to repair his van.

loans.use: repair his van

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and four siblings, some of whom are still attending school. He has worked in a local supermarket since 2009. As is common for Lebanese young men, he is working and pursuing his education at same time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to pay his education fees. His only purposes are to help his father to pay his education fees and avoid having financial problems with the campus management. He has lots of future plans in his mind; one of them is to become a manager in a large company where he can earn a good income and live satisfactorily.

loans.use: to pay his education fees.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with his parents and two siblings. He has been working as a women's hairdresser since 2007. He works on a freelance basis serving customers at their homes. Today, he is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., in order to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies. In the future, he is planning to take more Kiva loans in order to open his own beauty salon and welcome customers appropriately.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, aged 31, is married to Josephat who operates a commercial vehicle. They are blessed with two children, aged seven and four.  Gladys has been running a general retail shop for the last two years, selling items such as cereals, snacks, sweets, etc. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 25,050.  

This is Gladys' first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy cereals such as rice, peas, lentils and other types of cereals to resell. She intends to use the anticipated profits to open an M-pesa outlet and hopes to own a supermarket in future.

loans.use: buy cereal grains to resell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 49-year-old single mother of one.  She does poultry farming to earn a living.  She has been in this business for three years.  Previously, she grew and sold vegetables.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Nancy has become more focused in her business.  She hopes to supply poultry products wholesale in the future.  Nancy has requested a loan for 20,000 Kes to buy chicks and chicken mash, and to enlarge her poultry house.

loans.use: buy chicks & chicken mash and enlarge her poultry house

loans.name: Buhoma Farmers Group

texts.en:
56-year-old Eliphaz is a brick sales businessman operating from Kihihi. He has been in this business for 8 years now.  Those 8 years have given him learning and capacity building experiences that he says have broadened his understanding of how his type of business operates. Kihihi, like most other towns in western Uganda, is experiencing a construction boom due to the fact that indigenous individuals who reside mostly in Kampala are increasingly resettling back to their places of origin.  

Eliphaz says he has always owed it to himself to work hard. Hard work he says has brought forth many changes for the good in his business. He says he began this business with savings from his farming enterprise. Monthly, he says his sales profits add up to 180,000 shillings.  He says with this loan, he is going to purchase a better brick-making machine.

loans.use: buy a brick making machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is 26 years old, single and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Rosette has a small retail shop, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Rosette has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Rosette hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. In the future, Rosette hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 25 years old, single and has no children. He has a small retail shop, which he has run for three years.
To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Charles hopes to generate greater profits and take care of himself. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale.

loans.name: Caro

texts.en:
Caro is 39 years old. She is widowed and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Caro has a business selling spare parts, which she has run for five years. She also has a second business selling clothes.
To help expand her business, Caro has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Caro hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is 41 years old, single and has four children, none of whom are currently in school. Joseline has a restaurant business, which she has run for two years. She also has a second business running a drug shop.
To help expand her business, Joseline has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for cooking at the restaurant. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Joseline hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more food for cooking at her restaurant.

loans.name: Zibora

texts.en:
Zibora is a hardworking lady who weaves baskets and ropes. She is very artistic and makes good baskets. For this reason, she has sustained her business for ten years. Apart from weaving baskets, she does farming to boost her income.  
Zibora hopes that, someday, she will open another shop to sell baskets and ropes. Her dream is to export her products. She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy threads, leather and sisal to make baskets.

loans.use: To buy threads, leather and sisal for making baskets.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 61-year-old, single mother of four children. She has been running a computer services shop for 7 years yielding an income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings per month. She offers typing, printing and design services.

She is taking her second loan with KADET after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use the loan to buy computer accessories which will be used to improve her business. Her hope is to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories to improve her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old, divorced and has six children, none of whom are currently in school. Joseph has a small retail shop, which he has run for five years. He also has a second business selling clothes.
To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Joseph hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a photocopier for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sausages, meat, and viscera in greater quantity and to provide preventative maintanence on her equipment.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 31 years old, married and has two children. He sells charcoal and works hard in his business to provide for his family. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money and he has been trained in business management.  
Joshua hopes to own a lorry for transporting charcoal in the future. He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 42-year-old widow with five children, three of whom are still younger than 18. This lady has been a fishmonger for the past five years in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

Grace has borrowed Kshs 20,000 from KADET LTD in her first loan cycle. She intends to use the loan to purchase more fish for her business, to put up a wooden structure to serve as her business premises and to plant seedlings on her farm as there is now rain. She wants to use the anticipated profits to continue looking after her family as well as to help grow her business by expanding her supply and diversifying the types of fish she sells.

In the future, Grace hopes to become a well-established fish supplier in the area.

loans.use: To add more stock of fish and use some money to plant on her farm as well

loans.name: Salem Plus Group

texts.en:
Paulin, aged 47 and married, is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Salem Plus” which consists of 12 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 
Paulin sells fertilizer and seeds to the west of Kinshasa. He started his business in 1993. Paulin is happy right now as, with the loan, he will be able to buy fertilizer and seeds, have a greater range of stock and be able to meet customer demand. Paulin makes a profit of US$100 per week. With the money he earns, he hopes to provide financial support for his family. His dream is to, someday, own a farm. Paulin has six children aged between 2 and 35. Three of them go to school. He also takes care of his two nephews.

loans.use: to increase his stock by buying sacks of fertilizer and seeds for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Manuel Agustin

texts.es: Manuel   vive con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 7 a 14 años  en Malambo, municipio ubicado en el área metropolitana de Barranquilla; allí  tiene el negocio de ofrecer lavadoras en condiciones de alquiler y también vende fritos diariamente. Su experiencia  data  desde cuando vivía en Ciénaga un municipio del departamento del Magdalena, donde tenía el servicio de lavadoras  y estaba administrado por su esposa,  pues él trabajaba en una empresa. Cuando trasladó la experiencia de servicios de lavandería a Malambo, observó el entorno e inició otro negocio: el de vender jugos fritos y pasteles aprovechando las habilidades culinarias de su cónyuge y su ubicación estratégica frente al lugar donde finaliza el recorrido de los buses municipales.  Con los dos negocios le ha ido muy bien,  porque ha logrado comprar más máquinas  de lavar y electrodomésticos,  perfeccionando su infraestructura. Su mayor desafío es el poco capital de trabajo con que cuenta y esta es la razón por la cual acude al credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará 1 lavadora, un calentador 1 licuadora y 1 bicicleta para el transporte de sus máquinas. Su sueño es adquirir una vivienda propia e incriminar sus posibilidades en el mercado,  ofreciendo servicios cada vez más oportunos, mientras esto ocurre continúa esforzándose por mantener su rentabilidad no menor de 56%, para lograr permanentemente ser efectivo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his spouse and their four children, ranging in age from 7 to 14.  They live in Malambo, a municipality in the metropolitan area of Barranquilla.  He has a business there offering washing machines for rent.  He also sells fried food daily.

His experience dates back to when he lived in Ciénaga, a municipality in the Magdalena department.  He had a washing machine service there, and his wife ran the business because he worked in a company.  When he moved the experience of washing machine service to Malambo, he observed the surroundings and started another business.  He started selling fried food, juice, and cakes by taking advantage of his wife’s culinary abilities and his strategic location.  The location is in front of the place where the municipal bus routes end.  

Both businesses have gone very well for him .  This is because he has managed to buy more washing machines and domestic appliances, which improved his infrastructure.  His greatest challenge is having little working capital.  That is the reason he is requesting a Kiva loan, which is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy one washing machine, a heater, one blender, and a bicycle to transport his machines.

His dream is to get his own house and to increase his possibilities in the market by offering timely services, more each time.  While this is happening he will continue putting forth his effort to keep his profitability at no less that 56% in order to always be effective in the market.

loans.use: to buy one washing machine, a heater, one blender, and a bicycle to transport his machines.

loans.name: Ihembe Tukwatanise Group

texts.en: 58-year-old Norah is a food sales business-woman operating in Kihihi in western Uganda. She has been in this business for over a decade. She mostly sells cereals and other foods at her stall. Norah is a widowed mother of 3 who says she started this business with savings from her charcoal sales business. Norah says she has been banking on hard work and prayers to reach where she is in her business. Weekly, she says her profits are shillings 70,000. With this Kiva loan, she says she will purchase more bags of cereals to resell

loans.use: to purchase more bags of cereals to resell

loans.name: Pajero Group

texts.en:
Verdiana, who is in her mid 30s, is married with four children who are still at school. She has been running a food shop but also sells fruit and vegetables in the same place. She has been in this business for 6 years. She works from 6.30am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants a loan to increase her shop inventory and stock of fruit and vegetables. Her dream is to, one day, own a big wholesale and retail general shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Pajero", which has a total of 17 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her shop inventory and stock of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Motuya Plus Group

texts.en:
Marie-France, aged 37, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Motuya Plus”. It is composed of 12 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Marie-France is married and has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1990. She sells beverages. Her business is located in the heart of Kinshasa. Marie-France has already received six loans through MFI HOPE DRC and repaid them correctly. The loan she will obtain next will be used to buy more crates of drinks to resell with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $60 per week. Marie-France’s ambition is to become a beverage provider in her area. She has two children aged 3 and 17 who attend school.

loans.use: to buy crates of beverages to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Venezuera Group

texts.en:
Aranyaeli is in his early 40s and married with four children who are still going to school.  He has a lorry which he is using for his transport business.  He gets tenders for delivering things like sand, small stones, roofing tiles and building materials.  He has been in this business for 5 years now.  He works from 6.00am to 7.30pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a Bajaji (tricycle), paid school fees and household expenses.  He has paid back all of his loans successfully.  He hopes for a loan to start poultry business.  His dream is to one day build another house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Venezuela" which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To start a poultry business.

loans.name: Baptiseurs Plus Group

texts.en:
“Baptiseurs Plus” is a group of 11 owners of small businesses chaired by Noel.  Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Noel’s main activity is to sell general hardware at the market located west of Kinshasa.  He started his business in 1993 selling second hand clothing with a beginning capital of US $10.  Due to the high demand for general hardware, Noel decided to change his business in order to generate more profit and achieve his dream to someday become a hardware provider in his community. 

Having repaid his previous seven loans properly from the MFI HOPE DRC, he intends to use his next loan to buy more general hardware and resell them at profit in order to generate additional profits.  Currently, Noel makes a profit of US $50 per week.  He is 43 years old, married and has five children aged 3 to 14.  Four of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase more kitchen hardware to resell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José es un hombre de 38 años de edad que vive con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 7 a 17 años en Costa Hermosa, Barrio ubicado en el Municipio de Soledad a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, en esta comunidad es muy conocido porque ofrece una rutina  de ejercicios dirigidos a través de un Gimnasio que inició en su casa, donde estuvo durante un año y posteriormente con el incremento de su clientela alquiló un local, fue acondicionándolo; en la actualidad  este recinto deportivo y recreativo, cuenta con 3 empleados  que trabajan con José,  en tres horarios diarios ; el primer turno de trabajo  es de 6:00 a.m./ 12 m, el segundo de 2:00 p.m. a 5:00 p.m. y el último del día de 6:00 a 9:00 p.m. José le ha gustado siempre esta actividad pues antes de iniciar su propio negocio,  se dedicaba personalmente a practicar aeróbicos y en las competencias siempre triunfaba;  desde muy temprano ha  vivido la actividad que hoy le genera ingresos con mucha emoción, por eso poco a poco compró maquinaria y equipos y con ello ha tenido éxito. En la actualidad está solicitando su primer financiamiento, por ello se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar 2 bicicletas y una eclíptica, porque su sueño y gran desafío es lograr mucha prosperidad con lo que más le gusta y con ello  adquirir su propia vivienda con el aumento de sus utilidades y aumentar el bienestar de su familia ofreciéndoles alternativas bases, para que en un futuro sean exitosos
texts.en:
José is a 38 year old man living with his spouse and four children, whose ages range from 7 to 17 years, in Costa Hermosa, a neighborhood located in the municipality of Soledad which is 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  

He is very well known in this community because he offers an exercise routine through a gym he started at home.  He was there for a year and later, with the increase in his customer base, he rented a locale that he gradually equipped.  Currently, this sports and recreation center has three employees that work with José in three shifts.  The first shift is from 6am to noon, the second is from 2pm to 5pm and the last shift of the day is from 6pm to 9pm.  

José has always enjoyed this activity because before opening his own business he personally did aerobics and always won in competition.  Since a very young age he has lived the work enthusiastically which now is his source of income.  Because of this, he has gradually bought machinery and equipment and has been successful with it.

He is currently requesting his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy two bicycles and an elliptical bike because his great dream and challenge is to attain much prosperity doing what he loves best and with his increased profits to be able to acquire a house of his own and increased wellbeing for his family offering them better bases for future success.

loans.use: to buy two bicycles and an elliptical bike.

loans.name: Trésor Plus Group

texts.en:
Wongudi is the leader of the Community Bank named “Trésor Plus” which is composed of 10 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Wongudi is 37 years old, married and has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2005.  He operates a general store to the north-east of Kinshasa.  He has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a larger store in Kinshasa. 

He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business that earns him $70 per week.  He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals.  Wongudi is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having obtained loans five times and promptly repaid them.  He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by buying cans, some sacks of rice, soaps, sugar and milk and reselling them at profit.  Wongudi has five children aged between 4 and 14 years old.  Three of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the store’s stock by buying cans, some sacks of rice, soaps, sugar and milk and reselling them at profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Book Liggueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Book Liggueye est crée le 31 Mai 2007. Il est composé de 14 femmes toutes du même quartier. 

Leur principale activité est le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 52 ans .
Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de produits divers tels la pâte d'arachide, l'huile de palme, les poissons fumés et les balaies.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de financer son activité de vente de produits divers. 
Son objectif est d'assurer une meilleur prise en charge de sa progéniture et d'améliorer sa condition de vie familiale. 

La femme en médaillon fait partie du groupe de solidarité, elle était absente lors de la prise de la photo.
texts.en:
The solidarity group called Book Liggueye was formed on May 31, 2007. It is composed of 14 women, all from the same neighborhood. Their principal activity is selling various small items.  

Madame Mariama, standing on the right raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 52 years old. She's married and has six children. 

She sells various goods such as peanut butter, palm oil, smoked fish, and brooms. Her new loan will serve as working capital for her small sales business. 

Her objective is to ensure that she can support her offspring and improve living conditions for her family. 

The woman in the snapshot is a member of the solidarity group who was absent when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy peanut butter, palm oil, smoked fish, and brooms.

loans.name: Kambing Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité kambing a été créé le 11 mai  2010.IL est constitué de 19 membres issus de la meme zone.Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Diaraye (tout à fait à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupement,elle est mariée ,elle est âgée de 25 ans et mère de 03 enfants.

Son activité principale est le commerce des tissus;elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de la vente de tissus pour l'avoir pratiquer plusieurs années.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des tissus de marques différentes pour satisfaire sa clientèle.

Son objectif est de participer au besoin familial à savoir la nourriture et surtout la prise en charge de la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The borrowing group Kambing was created on May 11, 2010. It consists of 19 members from the same area.  Their main activity is small business.

Mrs. Diaraye (far right of the photo) is the group leader.  She is married, 25 years old, and mother of 3 children.

Her main business is the sale of fabric. She has solid experience in the sale of fabric after several years of doing it.

Her loan will allow her to buy different brands of fabric to meet the needs of her customers.

Her goal is to contribute to the feeding her family and especially to take care of the health of her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Keila Jolany

texts.en:
Keila Jolany lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras with her two parents, both of whom she helps support economically. For the past six years, she has operated a photocopying service out of her home. In addition to running her business, Keila Jolany raises chickens and pigs at home.

Keila Jolany is a first-time borrower and she is requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL to buy paper and toner for her photocopying business.

loans.use: to purchase toner and paper for her photocopying business

loans.name: Saint Christophe Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité saint Christophe a été créé le 11 mai 2010. IL est composé de 21 membres issus de la même zone. Elles ont pour activé principale le commerce.

Madame Mariame en écharpe rouge et à l’extrême droite sur la photo, est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 24 ans,elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.

Elle a pour activité principale la vente de l'huile de palme.
ELLE a une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquer pendant plusieurs années.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter en quantité suffisante de l'huile de palme pour pouvoir satisfaire la demande de ses clients.

Son objectif est d'acheter une maison et de participer aux charges de la famille: nourriture, scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The borrowing group Saint Christophe was created on May 11, 2010. It consists of 21 members from the same area.  Their main activity is business.

Mrs. Mariame in the red scarf at the far right of the photo is the group leader.  She is 24 years old, married, and mother of 2 children.  Her main business is the sale of palm oil.  

She has solid experience in this activity after having done it for several years.

Her loan will allow her to buy sufficient quantities of palm oil to meet her customers' demand.

Her goal is to buy a house and contribute to the family expenses: food, children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy palm oil

loans.name: Tacku Liguéye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité tacku liguéye  a été créé le 31 mai 2010.Il est composé de 16 femmes issues de la même localité .Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Awa est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 48 ans,elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants.Cependant elle prend en charge aussi un autre enfant dont elle a la responsabilité de la garde.

Elle avait pour activité antérieure les travaux ménagers;travail auquel elle s'est adonnée pendant une courte période.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en mil pour le transformer en couscous en vue de le revendre.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et sa capacité d'épargne .
texts.en:
The borrowing group Tacku Ligueye was created on May 31, 2010. It consists of 16 women from the same region.  Their main activity is small business.
Mrs. Awa is the group leader.  She is 48 years old, married, and mother of 6 children.  But she also takes care of another child whom she has custody of.  Her prior business was housekeeping, work she did for a short period.  Her loan will allow her to stock up on millet to transform it into couscous for resale.  Her goal is to increase her revenues and her ability to save money.

loans.use: to buy millet

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mère de 03 enfants, Afi est mariée à un électronicien. Pour joindre les deux bouts et  épauler son conjoint dans l’éducation de leur enfant, elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure en 2006  après sa formation de coiffeuse. Elle est âgée de 32 ans et d’une bonne réputation, pour  s’assurer du gain journalier elle vend divers article comme les produits de beauté et des chaussures. Ce troisième prêt va lui permettre d’augmenter le stock existant. Ses provisions se font sur place.
texts.en: A mother of three, Afi is married to an electronics technician. To make ends meet and support her spouse for her children's education, she opened her hair salon in 2006 after training as a hairdresser. She is 32 years old and has a good reputation. To ensure a daily profit, she sells various articles such as cosmetics and shoes. This third loan will allow her to increase her existing stock. She gets her supplies locally.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Domou Ndeye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Domou ndéye a été créé le 31 mai 2010.Il est composé de 26 membres issus de la meme zone.Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Hafsatou est responsable du groupement;elle est âgée de 42 ans ;elle est mariée et vit avec 05 enfants.

Sa principale activé est la vente de Karité;activité à laquelle elle dispose d'une bonne expérience.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter de la karité en stock suffisant dans le marché pour les revendre.

Son objectif est de réfectionner sa maison, s'occuper de la nourriture et de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Domou Ndéye was created March 31, 2010. It is made up of 26 members from the same area. They are mainly involved in small sales businesses.

Madame Hafsatou is the leader of the group. She is 42 years old, married, and lives with five children. Her main business is selling shea butter, and she has good experience in this business.

Her loan will allow her to buy shea from the market in sufficient quantities to resell.

Her goal is to renovate her house and pay for her children's food and schooling.

loans.use: to buy shea butter.

loans.name: Yermandé Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité a été créé  le 31 mai 2010.IL est composé de 25 femmes membres issus du même quartier.
Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Adia Christine est responsable du groupement, elle est âgée de 35 ans et s'occupe de ses trois enfants.
Elle a pour activité principale le petit commerce de tissus et des effets de toilettes.En plus elle travaille comme femme de ménage pour accroitre ses revenus.

La couture constituait son activité antérieure,domaine dans lequel elle possédait une courte expérience.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des tissus et des articles de toilettes en quantité suffisante pour majorer son chiffre d'affaire.

Son objectif est d'acquérir une maison et soutenir ses enfants dans leurs études.
texts.en:
The Yermandé solidarity group was created 31 May 2010. It consists of 25 members from the same neighborhood.
Their main activity is small retail business.

Mrs. Christine A... is responsible for the group. She is 35 years old and takes cares of her three children.
Her main activity is small trade of clothing fabrics and toiletries, in addition to which she works as a housekeeper to increase her income.

Sewing was her previous activity, an area where she gained some experience.

Her loan will allow her to buy fabrics and toiletries in sufficient quantities to increase her turnover.

Her objective is to acquire a home and to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy toiletries

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.en:
Jose Andres lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras with his wife and three children. He makes various types of wooden furniture that he sells in Choluteca and Tegucigalpa, and receives assistance from his family in running the business. 

Jose Andres is a new client and he is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL to buy wood, glue, nails, screws, wood stain, and other furniture-making supplies. In his free time, Jose Andres enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make furniture

loans.name: Idrissou

texts.fr: Boucher de profession, Idrissou est marié et père de 06  enfants. Agée de 37 ans, et soucieux du bien-être de ses enfants il n’épargne aucun effort pour subvenir à leurs besoins et évidemment de sa femme. Il s’approvisionne de  bœufs  dans la commune de  Tsévié localité située à 35 km au nord de Lomé. Il revend vers le port de pêche après abattage. Il est dans sa 11ième année  dans cette activité.
texts.en:
A butcher by trade, Idrissou is married and the father of six children. He is 37 years old and concerned with his children's well-being. He spares no effort to meet their needs and those of his wife. 

He gets his cattle in the Tsévié community, an area located 35 km north of Lomé. After butchering, he sells beef near the fishing port. This is his eleventh year in this business.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Teofilo Cesario

texts.es:
Teofilo Cesario tiene 42 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Teofilo se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar mas terrenos para seguir trabajando.

Le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Teofilo Cesario is 42 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas Canton in the Los Rios province.

The members of the La Union Communal bank are located in the Aguas Frias de Medellin precinct, which is in the Ventanas canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Teofilo grows corn and rice.  He makes his purchases in Ventantas, and he sells at fairs every day, especially on Sundays.

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure.  The support of the loan will help supply him with the necessities.  

The challenges he faces are competition and climate changes.

His dream is to buy more land in order to continue working.

He likes working in the field.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure.

loans.name: Christian Robert

texts.es:
Christhian Robert  tiene 20 años, Es soltero vive con un hermano no tiene hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Christhian se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz desde hace tres años aprendio de su padre en el Recinto Las Lomas, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es casarse tener una familia grande, tener casa propia y trabajar mas y seguir cultivando.

Le gusta salir los domingos a caminar.
texts.en:
Christhian Robert is 20 years old.   He is single, and does not have children.  He lives with a brother in the Ventanas Canton in the Los Rios Province.

The members of the La Union Communal bank are located in the Aguas Frias de Medellin Precinct, which is in the Ventanas Canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Christhian has been growing corn for three years.  He learned from his father in the Las Lomas Precint.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas.  He sells at the fairs every day, especially on Sundays.

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure.  The support of the loan will help supply him with the necessities.  

The challenges he faces are competition and climate changes.

His dreams are to have a large family, to have his own house, to work more, and to continue growing crops.

On Sundays he likes to go walking.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure.

loans.name: Asuncion Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama la "Asuncion" esta ubicado en el estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por nueve integrantes, entre ellas se encuentra la señora Mayola originaria de la localidad. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada desde hace 18 años, tiene 3 hijos (dos hombres y una mujer) vende lenceria desde hace cinco años, decidio iniciar su negocio para ayudar a su esposo a cubrir algunos gastos de la casa ya que los ingresos son bajos, su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos tengan un mejor calidad de vida y terminen una carrera universitaria por esta razón busca alternativas de trabajo para poder darles una mejor vida, con el prestamo que le otorguen lo utilizará para surtir mejor su mercancia ya que así tiene la oportunidad de comprar en cantidades mayores y con un mejor precio logrando tener más ganancias para el crecimiento de su negocio y la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Asuncion group is located in the state of Mexico.  The group is comprised of nine members.  Mayola is a member who is a originally from the area.  She is 35 years old, and she has been married for 18 years.  She has three children (two boys and a girl).  She has been selling lingerie for five years.  She decided to start her business in order to help her husband cover some household expenses because his income is low.

Her greatest desire is for her children to have a better quality of life and that they finish their university studies.  That is the reason she looks for work alternatives in order to be able to give them a better life.

She will use the loan that she gets to better stock her merchandise.  That way she has the opportunity to buy larger quantities for a better price.  Then she will get more income in order for her business to grow and for the quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lingerie for her business.

loans.name: Jimmy Omar

texts.es:
Jimmy Omar tiene 19 años, Es soltero vive con la madre y un hermano, no tiene hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Jimmy se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz  desde hace tiempo, pues es una actividad que le enseño su padre fallecido, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para tener dinero y ayudar a su madre y hermano.

Le gusta salir a la ciudad de Ventanas a visitar a los amigos.
texts.en:
Jimmy Omar is 19 years old. He is single and lives with his mother and one brother. He has no children. He lives in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. 

The members of "LA UNION" communal bank come together in the Aguas Frías de Medellín neighborhood, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank work in agriculture, planting short-cycle crops such as corn, rice and pole beans. 

Jimmy has worked in agriculture for some time, planting corn. His late father taught him this profession. He buys what he needs in Ventanas, and he sells his crops at the daily markets, especially the Sunday market. 

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and compost. With the help of the loan, he will be able to improve his economic situation so that he can cover his needs. Some of the challenges he faces are the competition and the changes in the climate. His dream is to keep working so that he can have money and help his mother and brother. 

He enjoys going to the city of Ventanas to visit his friends.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Tres Marias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TRES MARIAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Teresa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de CD’s, venta de artefactos, venta de comida, bordador, producción y venta de zapatos, venta de coca, costura de chamarras.

La señora Teresa,  indica que este es el quinto mes que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una vecina. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de bordados en computadora, que lleva trabajando hace seis años atrás; ella nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió estudiando, pues de profesión es informática.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela para diseño, hilos, pello, etc.), que compraran por mayor de la ceja y elaborara los productos en su casa todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las amigas ya la facilidad de acceder al consultorio de salud.
texts.en:
The “TRES MARIAS” ["Three Marias"] communal bank is beginning its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II Center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors, headed by Teresa. The businesses carried out by the members of the communal bank are varied, including CD sales, the sale of artifacts, food sales, embroidery, shoe production and sales, coca sales, and the production of tailored jackets. 

Teresa indicates that this is the fifth month she has worked with Pro Mujer, and she joined on the invitation of a neighbor. Currently, she has a business providing computer-based embroidery, which she has operated for six years. She reports that she learned this business as a student, since she studied information technology. 

The loan she is now requesting is to increase her capital (buying fabric for her designs, thread, backing material, etc.). She will buy these items wholesale at La Ceja market, and she will produce her products at home every day. This manner of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, since she is married and has one child. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the friends there and the ease of gaining access to health care.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and backing material.

loans.name: Rakiyatou

texts.fr: Le premier crédit que Mme Rakiyatou  sollicite lui servira à acheter des bijoux au BENIN (pays voisin). Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et ils ont 01 enfant en charge. Depuis 2004 elle se donne à cette activité en faisant sa vente à domicile. Elle veut assurer un avenir radieux à son enfant et aider son mari  et avoir sa propre boutique pour installer ses marchandises.
texts.en:
This is the first loan that Madame Rakiyatou is seeking, and it will serve to buy jewelry in Benin (a neighboring country). She is married to a driver, and they support one child. 

She has been in this business since 2004, selling from her home. She wants to ensure a bright future for her child, help her husband, and have her own shop to set up her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Virginia Griselda

texts.es:
Virginia Griselda tiene 53 años, Es madre soltera vive con los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Virginia se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz, frejol desde hace 20 años, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es las plagas y enfermedades y la variación del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Le gusta hacer ejercicio.
texts.en:
Virginia is 53 years old, and a single mother who lives with her children, in Ventanas canton, De los Rios province.

The members of “La Union” (The Union) communal bank live in Recinto Aguas Frias in Medellin, located in Ventanas canton. The bank's members are dedicated to agriculture on the short cycle, sowing corn, rice, and green pigeon beans.

Virginia has grown corn and beans since she was 20 years old. She makes her purchases in Ventanas and her sales in the daily fairs, especially the Sunday fair.

Virginia is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure. The loan will help her economically by supplying these necessities. She must confront challenges including plant plagues and infirmities and climate variations.

Her dream is to have her own house. Virginia likes to exercise.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.fr:
Âgée de 41ans marié et père de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie de 18ans à 2ans et ayant 3 personnes en charges, ayant une ferme et  vendant d’aliment de bétails en gros depuis 1985 avec un capital de 150.000Frs.sa vente  journalière est de 16500Frs et ses recettes augmentent  pendant la période des fêtes.

Sa discipline dans la gestion, lui permet de réaliser plus de bénéfices malgré quelques difficultés qui sont: les payements des taxes fictifs, les pénuries des produits sur le marché d'approvisionnement.

Avec le prêt  actuel, il veut augmenter son stock de marchandise en achetant: des poules, des coqs et de l’aliment de bétail en gros. La vente domicile et au marché lui permet de contribuer à la scolarité de ses enfants.

Elle compte les soutenir jusqu'à leur indépendance totale. C’est un homme responsable.
texts.en:
Alphonse is 41 years old, married, and the father of five children who vary in age between 18 and two years old.  He looks after three others, has a farm, and has sold feed in bulk since 1985 with capital of 150,000 Frs.  His daily sales total 16,500 Frs and increase during the holiday seasons.

His managerial discipline has allowed him to earn greater profits despite several difficulties that exist: payments of fictitious taxes and shortages of products in the market supply.

With  this loan, he would like to increase his stock of merchandise by purchasing: chickens, roosters, and feed in bulk.  Sales conducted from his home and in the market will allow him to contribute to the schooling of his children.  He intends to support them until their are fully independent.  He is a responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase hens, roosters, and feed.

loans.name: Ama Enyonam

texts.fr: Agée de 38ans, Ama vend des verres des tasses au marché de Hédzranawoé  depuis 2007.  Elle est mère d’un enfant et est mariée à un médecin.  Ce premier prêt lui servira à acheter des objets de cuisine au Port Autonome de Lomé afin de répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en:
Ama is 38 years old. She is married to a doctor and has one child. She has been selling drinking cups and glasses at the Hédzranawoé market since 2007. 

She will use this first loan to buy kitchen items at Port Autonome in Lomé. This will help her to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy glasses for resale

loans.name: Eudocio

texts.en:
Eudocio is originally from Peru but moved to the United States 15 years ago. He owns a fiberglass manufacturing company with his wife. Eudocio had experience manufacturing car parts when he expanded to the boat industry four years ago. He generates most of his projects from community members but hopes to work with bigger customers in the area.
As a returning client, Eudocio has seen the great impact a loan can have on his business. Since coming to Kiva partner, ACCION USA, in 2009, Eudocio has been able to better keep up with his customers' demands. With new molds and materials, he has been able to work on bigger boats, for recreational and fishing purposes, as well as manufacturing more auto parts. His greatest challenge has been overcoming the hardships of the financial crisis and keeping his business strong.
With this new loan from ACCION USA, Eudocio will be able to hire a part-time worker to assist him in manufacturing and contribute to his growing business. He hopes his business will continue to thrive so that it becomes well known.

loans.use: to hire a part- time worker to assist him with manufacturing.

loans.name: Ventilla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VENTILLA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, comercio según la ocasión, venta de refrescos, inicio de negocio, venta de productos AVON, tejido de mantas, venta de zapatos, kiosco surtido

La señora María,  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando con la lectura del folleto y por invitación de una vecina. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos, que inicio conjuntamente su esposo, desde hace medio año. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de cosméticos). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Eva porque tuvo que ir porque una de sus hijas se encontraba enferma y requeria atención.
texts.en:
The VENTILLA community bank, associated with Centro Senkata, is embarking on its first round of funding from Pro Mujer.  The group's eight members are lead by a board headed by Sra. Maria.  The members of the group operate a wide range of retail businesses: corner shops; sales of seasonal merchandise; cola sales; Avon product sales; crafts sales; shoe sales; and kiosk sales.

Sra. Maria says that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined, at the invitation of a friend, after reading a brochure about the bank.  She operates a business selling cosmetics, a business that she started with her husband six months ago.  

She will use the loan to stock her business (with cosmetics).  The business provides her with a means to support her family that is better than any other open to her.

Sra. Eva had to leave before the photograph was taken because she had to tend to a daughter who was ill.

loans.use: to buy products for her cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Bienvenue

texts.fr:
Femme âgée de 43ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant âgé de 21ans, elle a un niveau terminal e, en 2004,  par manque de soutient  elle avait préféré de  se lancer dans la vente de foufou en gros et détail avec un capital de 400.000Frs.

Ses recettes sont 150.000F à 425.000F après 2 jours  et elle vend non loin de son domicile ce qui lui permet de commencer très tôt son activité.

Avec le prêt de HOPE, elle veut renforcer le stock de son aliment en achetant des sacs de foufou 
Très gentille, son souhait est toujours de satisfaire ses clients en leur offrant des meilleurs prix.

Pour le bien de sa famille, elle compte construire une maison et voyager pour l’achat des marchandises.
texts.en:
A 43 year old woman, married with one child aged 21,she reached the end of high school  but in 2004  due to lack of support she chose to take up the sale of fufu wholesale and retail with a starting capital of 400.000Frs.

Her income is from 150.000F to 425.000F for two days and she has her commerce not far from her home which enables her to open her business very early.

With the loan from Hope, she wants to increase her stock of fufu by buying sacks of it.
